characteristics.name: body
characteristics.description: Refers to mouthfeel. The tactile feel of the malt in the mouth. Largely a reflection of the physical qualities, but can also be significantly affected by flavor elements.

characteristics.name: floral
characteristics.description: Reminiscent of flowers and herbal elements.

characteristics.name: fruity
characteristics.description: Distinct flavors of fruits such as cherries, green apples, grapes, raisins, etc.

characteristics.name: malty
characteristics.description: Refers to the aroma and flavor of malted barley. 'Malt' can also be an abbreviation of 'Single Malt Scotch Whisky'.

characteristics.name: medicinal
characteristics.description: Evocative of memories of liquid medicines.

characteristics.name: nutty
characteristics.description: Evocative of the taste of nuts, or reminiscent of the alkaloid qualities of some nuts.

characteristics.name: smokey
characteristics.description: A peat fire has traditionally provided the heat to dry the malted barley used in Scotch whisky production. A significant flavor element in many malts, this heavy, smoky, somewhat vegetative flavor is imparted by the distillery water having run over peat, the peat smoke used in the drying process, or both.

characteristics.name: spicy
characteristics.description: Reminiscent of spices such as cinnamon, clove, or nutmeg.

characteristics.name: sweet
characteristics.description: Either sweet in itself, or reminiscent of sweetness. Frequently implies a 'wet' feeling in the mouth.

characteristics.name: tobacco
characteristics.description: Different from the peatiness of the whisky. Itâ€™s reminiscent of bonfires, leaf fires, log fireplaces, cigar tobacco, pipe tobacco, or something else.
